abstract: New York City Dept of Investigation report faults city's Housing Authority for failing to comply with elevator safety laws or respond to urgent complaints about elevator breakdowns, lapses that may have contributed to death of 84-year-old Olegario Pabon in Bronx housing project elevator in December.

headline.print_headline: City’s Housing Agency Faulted for ‘Significant Flaws’ in Elevator Safety
headline.main: New York City Housing Authority Faulted for ‘Significant Flaws’ in Elevator Safety

snippet: A report by the Department of Investigation, started after an 84-year-old man died in an elevator in December, said the housing agency was too slow to react to problems on elevators.
lead_paragraph: A report by the Department of Investigation, started after an 84-year-old man died in an elevator in December, said the housing agency was too slow to react to problems on elevators.
